meanings.sent1: I need to rethread the needle to finish sewing the button.
meanings.sent2: She had to rethread the lace through the eyelet to fix her shoe.
meanings.sent3: After the cat played with the yarn, I had to rethread it through the knitting needle.
meanings.sent4: He had to rethread the story to make it more believable.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to rethread the path through the dense forest to find his way back.

meanings.definition: To put a new thread through (a needle, hole, etc.)
meanings.sent1: Can you rethread the string through the tiny hole in the button?
meanings.sent2: She carefully rethreaded the ribbon through the loop on the gift box.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to rethread the acorn through the small crack in the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to rethread the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The spider had to rethread its web after the rain washed it away.

meanings.definition: To redo or repair (a damaged thread)
meanings.sent1: I had to rethread the frayed rope to make it usable again.
meanings.sent2: He quickly rethreaded the torn seam on his shirt before going out.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had to rethread the unraveling hem of the dress.
meanings.sent4: She had to rethread the conversation after the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to rethread the stripped screw to fix the machine.
